item.title: Explicit constants for Fejer-type smoothing on finite cyclic groups
item.description: arXiv:2512.03085v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We study a Fejer-type smoothing kernel on the finite cyclic group Z/NZ. For each smoothing radius we give explicit l1 and l2 norms, compute the discrete Fourier transform, and record bounds that are uniform in N. As an application we prove a smoothed discrepancy estimate with explicit constants that can be used in quantitative problems on finite cyclic groups. The arguments are elementary and the note is intended as a self contained reference.
item.dc:creator: Justin Grieshop

item.title: A proof of irrationality of $\pi$ based on nested radicals with roots of $2$
item.description: arXiv:2511.21776v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In this work, we consider four theorems that can be used to prove the irrationality of $\pi$. These theorems are related to nested radicals with roots of $2$ of kind $c_k = \sqrt{2 + c_{k - 1}} $ and $c_0 = 0$. Sample computations showing how the rational approximation tend to $\pi$ with increasing the integer $k$ are presented.
item.dc:creator: Sanjar M. Abrarov, Rehan Siddiqui, Rajinder Kumar Jagpal, Brendan M. Quine
